name: Sir Francis Drake Hotel - a Kimpton Hotel

reviews.text: Stayed here for three nights in April with four friends - it was a great experience. Check-in was efficient and we were allowed to go straight to our rooms despite arriving well before the 3.00pm check-in time. I loved the reception area and lobby - it was very grandiose! The twin double room was spacious, clean and the beds were really comfortable. We had a great view of Union Square and Macy's. I loved the Aveda products in the bathroom and dressing gowns (one in tiger skin print, the other in zebra skin print!) were an added bonus! The hotel is in a superb location - lots of great diners (try Roxy's just up the street from the hotel), restaurants (try E&O Trading Company around the corner), bars and cafés within 5 minutes walk; Chinatown 5 minutes walk and right beside Union Square and great shopping! Also, the cable car ($5 per ride) stops right outside the hotel and brings you out to all that is Fisherman's Wharf. We also spent two of our nights in the hotel's top floor bar - Harry Denton's Starlight Room - this has spectacular night time views of San Fran, a comprehensive cocktail menu, excellent service, live music, hopping DJs, a busy dancefloor and a great atmosphere. I hope to go back to SF and would absolutley definitely stay here again - I have already recommended it to family and friends intending to travel to SF and all of the above for a fantastic price!
reviews.title: Great Hotel; Great Location

likes.liked: — Great price for a great hotel in a great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed last week for the first few days of our honeymoon and it was PERFECT! We traveled on to Napa after San Fran and I really did not want to leave the Sir Francis Drake!!!!
reviews.title: Can't wait to go back!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our King room was on a corner overlooking Union Square. It was incredibly clean, bright, and beautifully decorated.
reviews.title: Great Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff knew it was our honeymoon and left a bottle of chilled champagne and a voucher for free drinks in our room while we were at dinner our first night. :-)
reviews.title: Great with the AAA rate!

likes.liked: — The overall experience of this hotel exceeded my expectations.
likes.disliked: — Union Square is a bit too busy for my tastes.

reviews.text: I would like to compliment the staff as well, they were very enthusiastic and kind. Not stuffy at all just real people that value customer service.
reviews.title: Great Stay at the S.F.Drake - Kimpton Scores Again

reviews.text: We booked our stay directly through the 800# at Kimpton Hotels. It was easy and fast. The hotel is in a very good location and is a good value for the money. The beds were very comfortable and the room we had (executive dbl dbl) was spacious but the bathrooms are small and can only allow one person at a time. The only negative I had was a standoffish staff member at the check in desk who confirmed my room type and saw that we were a family of four but never took the time to advise me that the extra sofa bed I was needing and expecting would not be in the room. So, we went to our room, found that it was missing, and had to call down to the front desk and inquire. We were offered two roll away beds, which I accepted. They filled our room completely but at least we all had a bed to ourselves. The hotel was a little bit dirty and certain things were left on the floor our entire stay! However, I still maintain that this is a good value given the prices of hotels in Union Square. Tip - park in the parking garage a block away for almost half the price of the hotel's valet service - $26 versus $45.
reviews.title: Good value and location

reviews.text: My husband and two sons (ages 9 and 11) stayed here for three nights during Spring break. It's a beautiful historic building and the rooms, though "cozy", are very nicely appointed. The doorman in his Beefeater uniform was very friendly and helpful and the Concierge was also very helpful. Parking is pricy ($45) per night for the valet, but anything in this location is bound to be. I loved the historic interior decor. My only complaint is that our 8th floor window was very dirty. Ask for an upper room. From the higher floors the noise from outside is just a pleasant city hum. From the lower floors, the constant ding-ding of the cable car could be annoying. On the plus side, there is a cable car stop right in front of the hotel. Also, the location is great if you like to walk to things like Union Square and Chinatown. Don't miss Sears Fine Foods just across the street. Really liked this hotel.
reviews.title: Great Hotel In Central Location
Nice hotel great location
reviews.text: Beds are comphy the staff are frendly and its a good price in a great location. The room may not be the largest I've ever stayed in,but if I wanted to stay in my room I would have stopped at home. The room was clean and the shower was powerfull and hot oh yeah the resturants are nice too.

we attended a wedding in the hotel in general the hotel was fine the room was very small infact so small one of the closet doors could not open fully. the bathroom was small but had a wonderful shower. The staff at the hotel were very helpful and friendly and the location of the hotel was perfect. I was dissapointed that the gym was not open but it is due to re open soon. The Star Light room was a nice place to start off the night and the q's for the lifts could be avoided by using the guest acces to the elevators located to your immediate left on entering the hotel. We read many different reviews on this hotel and were put off by them but now having stayed I would recommend it as a reasonable 3 star hotel not the most fancy but in a great location however rooms size is a problem. If you could afford to upgrade to a suite it would be well worth the money they were beutiful and very spacious. I would also recommend using the hotel cars for airport runs €35 one way.
reviews.title: average hotel

reviews.text: Stayed for 1 night and went to an event in a meeting room on the 2nd floor.
reviews.title: Mini-Accomodations in a fine old building

likes.liked: — Location and the beautiful old building...

reviews.text: The Sir Francis Drake is perfectly located, in a nice neighborhood, with access to many types of public transportation.
reviews.title: Great Location, Friendly Staff, Excellent Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff is attentive, approachable, and friendly.
reviews.title: The Drake is Great!

reviews.text: The rooms are lovely . Very nicely decorated with comfortable beds. The bathrooms are a little small but what they lack in size they make up for in charm.
reviews.title: Quaint hotel, great locaton
Avoid unless your goal is a sub standard experince
reviews.text: One area for improvment is the temperature in the hotel lobby bar. The automatic doors constantly open and close, letting the wind into the space. It must be very difficult to heat (w/the high ceilings) but perhaps hanging a velvet curtain would help block out the wind.
All around, though, a great stay. Thank You!
reviews.title: Good value. Great lobby. Fabulous location.

reviews.text: We stayed at the Sir Francis Drake for 2 nights a Thursday and Friday. We got an excellent rate directly through the hotel on a king room. The bathroom is a little on the small side but was expected being that this is a city hotel. While small it was definitely manageable for 2 of us.
reviews.title: Nice hotel

reviews.text: The location is awesome and the lobby was beautiful, we enjoyed great cocktails in the lobby bar both nights. The bartender was friendly and offered to make me something great, and that it was.
reviews.title: Exceptional hospitality wraps perfect package at Sir Francis Drake

likes.disliked: — So much traffic in and out front entrance, hard to keep up with litter

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bellman and doorman were Fab - they were quick to help with our bags upon arrival and departure and the beefeater was happy to take a picture with us.
reviews.title: Still waiting on my refund....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The starlight room on the 21st floor had a strange crowd and was overpiced so I would skip that next time but would absolutely stay at the drake again.
reviews.title: really overpriced

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After seeing the mixed reviews the Sir Francis Drake had drawn, I decided to experience it myself and see if it met my high standards. It far exceeded even my high expectations. When I have the good fortune to return, I will hope stay at this property again. The exceptional quality of the hospitality wrapped up a perfect package for a five day stay. The service was obliging, efficient, and friendly. Staff sometimes added the personal touch of addressing me by name. From managers to the staff at the registration desk, from the bellstaff to the incredibly resilient crew of hardy and handsome gentlemen who form the ranks of the Beefeater costume-clad doormen, I was impressed with how everyone on the team exerted themselves to provide a top-notch experience for hotel guests.
reviews.title: Very accomodating staff

likes.liked: — Great deal for the price: clean with a very friendly staff, but cheap.
likes.disliked: — Room was worn down (peeling/missing paint and wallpaper; carpet curling up at the walls, etc.)

reviews.text: Let me start by saying that I'm the cynical type, so if I write something nice about a stay, the place just might be worth a look . . .
reviews.title: Excellent Stay at the Sir Francis Drake Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you are seeking a grand hotel, a smaller version of New York's Plaza Hotel, then you've come to the right place. With a location in the Union Square district, it is just about as central as you could want to be. They've spent a lot of effort overhauling this building and it shows; just the right combination of old marble and new interior design.
reviews.title: We will definitely stay here again!

reviews.text: Transportation: outside is the cable car, though you should walk a couple of blocks down the hill to catch it, because it's filled to the brim with tourists by the time it passes the hotel. Go a couple of blocks further down the hill and catch the underground. Secret: To get to fisherman's wharf/alcatraz, if you get fed up waiting for the cable car, hit the underground; take it out to the embarcadero/ferry building and then take a trolley along the waterfront to the wharf. A lot less crowded . . . On the return, retrace your steps but at the Ferry Building, walk toward the subway and take the OTHER (Powell/Hyde?) cable car back home, since its not crowded. Get a map from the concierge and you'll get the picture.
reviews.title: Regrettable Experience

likes.liked: — Location and Rachel at the front desk

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Shopping: One door down is Saks Fifth Ave. Turn the corner and you are in the shopping district if that is your thing. It's much denser shopping than New York; you get every brand on top of each other in a few blocks.
reviews.title: The Drake - Central location in SF, Rooms nice and updated

likes.liked: — the room - comfy bed, light-blocking curtains, very nice bathroom
likes.disliked: — free coffee in lobby is delicious but it's taken away too soon

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Amenities: Rooms are recently upgraded and it shows. Comfortable and quiet. The staff are exceedingly helpful. A concierge and doorman who actually know the town well and have a great attitude.
reviews.title: Classy, with a great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Sir Francis Drake for 5 nights in July. We booked the hotel due to its central location just a few steps away from Union Square and all the great shops and we weren't disappointed. Chinatown is also within walking distance and the cable car stops right outside the hotel for getting to Fisherman's Wharf. From the moment we checked in the staff were courteous and helpful.
reviews.title: Great hotel - superb staff

reviews.text: Unfortunately during our trip I had a bike accident and had to attend the hospital to get stitches in my leg. Hilary (the concierge) went out of her way to help by phoning the doctor and the hospital as well as Blazing Saddles Bike Hire to sort things out for us. The bar staff (especially Aaron) were also very friendly always saying hello and enquiring how I was doing.
reviews.title: Comfortable but Anonymous Stay at Sir Francis Drake

reviews.text: We had breakfast most mornings in Sears (directly across from the hotel) which was really good. We had dinner in E&O Trading, Neptunes Palace at Fishermans Wharf and the Cheesecake Factory in Macys. We also ate in the hotel restaurant Scala's. The food and atmosphere was great - very handy when you don't feel like walking too far.
reviews.title: SO-SO

reviews.text: All in all I would thoroughly recommend the Sir Francis Drake to anyone staying in San Francisco. The actual hotel is nice but it is the staff that makes it stand out from the rest!
reviews.title: Great Stay at Sir Francis!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The best feature of this hotel is its central location and the close proximity to Union Square.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, only a few issues

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Really liked this hotel. It was very impressive from the front and the reception area. We'd asked for a "quiet room, away from the street" and that's exactly what we got!! However, we didn't have a proper window in the room (more an impression that there was one!) but this just made us laugh.
reviews.title: Excellent location

reviews.text: The Sir Francis Drake is one of SF's 'grande dames' of hotels, which you can see by their lobby and their central location near Union Square. It also means that the hotel (particularly the hallways) is somewhat structurally outdated but the Kimpton group did a nice job renovating the rooms, incl. Aveda products and wifi-throughout the hotel. The service was very friendly.
reviews.title: Nice, centrally located hotel

reviews.text: You should definitely check out the Starlight room on top for a drink with a view, and the close-by 'Crepe o Chocolat'-bistro for homemade organic foods (75 O'Farrel Street, one bloc south of Union Square)!
reviews.title: Loved the Sir Francis Drake!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The SF Drake was wonderful! Its location cannot be beat for getting around the city and jumping on the cable car or walking over to Market St. to catch the new trains or over to Sutter for a bus. It is walking distance to many sights: Union Square shops, Yerba Buena Gardens and MOMA, the SF Center (now called Westfield) and of course, Chinatown. Our room was moderate in size...2 queen beds and a small bathroom, but was recently renovated and was clean and had a nice, stylish decor. I agree with what some have said about the windows...you really cannot see out of them because they are so dirty, but we were not in our rooms for much of the time and the view was not all that important to us. What we loved was the ambiance of the hotel...a charming, lovingly restored property that has a very friendly staff and provided all the ammenities we could have asked for. We traveled with our 2 young children and they loved the "Beefeaters" who stand guard the hotel and are happy to help or pose for photos. The lobby has a nice bar for meeting friends and having a drink. The hotel has an elegant feel without being too pretentious...it was comfortable and inviting. And, without doubt, the best location for getting around the Beautiful City by the Bay!!
reviews.title: Worth staying if you're visiting San Fran

likes.liked: — The room. It was very stylish.
likes.disliked: — Having to wait for our room to be ready before checkiong in.

reviews.text: Enjoyed our time at the hotel. Good location, nice rooms, friendly service.
reviews.title: Great Location! Definitelly "Historic"

reviews.text: They only thing I didn't like was that they could have a room for us at 2:30 PM for an early check-in but we just passed the time for 30 minutes getting a drink at the bar and the bartender was friendly.
reviews.title: Only worth it if the sleeping room rate is severly discounted

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at the Sir Francis Drake for two nights as part of a driving trip down the coast of California. Though all problems that we had with this hotel were taken care of, I would not stay here again.
reviews.title: Good stay, except for the bed

likes.disliked: — disgusting sheets and smoky non-smoking room

reviews.text: Our check-in was slow because there were many people in line at the same time. This wasn't anyone's fault, but it was a bit annoying. When we did finally get our room, we noticed that it was a smoking room. We had requested a non-smoking room because smoke really bothers my allergies. When we double-checked with the front desk, they said this was a non-smoking room; however, someone had clearly been smoking in it. They graciously changed our room; however, this one had its own problems.
reviews.title: Past it's Sell by Date

reviews.text: The second room, on its surface, looked ok. It was small but relatively nice -- or at least that's how it looked until we pulled back the comforter on the bed. When we settled in for the evening, we noticed that there was a blood stain and several other white stains on the sheets. We found this absolutely repulsive, but because I was so sick that night, we just threw a towel over it and slept on it anyway. The sheets were changed the next day, and the desk staff was very accommodating, but I would still not stay there again.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This property has Grand Pretentiousness but it is past it's sell by date.
reviews.title: A nice and classic hotel with good location

reviews.text: The entrance is grand but drab,
reviews.title: Avoid Sir Francis Drake

likes.disliked: — the quality of the room and services

reviews.text: Stayed at the hotel for a business conference and extended our stay to see sights and family in the area. Booked our stay through the Kimpton program and then confirmed the room and specific requests (crib, coffee pot, childproofing items) that were available to Kimpton members.
reviews.title: i was disappointed and room was dangerous

likes.disliked: — Safety issues and staff's inattentiveness to problems

reviews.text: Checkin was prompt and pleasant. Room on initial inspection was clean, nice decor and small bathroom with deep tub. We had to call multiple times for the crib and coffee pot over the next coupla hours before they were received. Childproofing items were never received.
reviews.title: Great Lobby Ok Rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On our fouth night there the air conditioning broke. Early the next morning I informed the front desk of the problem. At lunch I reminded them again. That afternoon I called twice due to the room being too hot for the kiddos to nap. Room temperature exceeded 85 degrees. Still no maintenance service. Spoke to someone at the front desk again on the way out to dinner. After dinner, no one had looked at the room yet. Went back down to the front desk and let them know that I was very unhappy at this point. Twenty minutes later maintenance finally arrived. (It's now 9.30 pm and the 3 year old and 3 month old are hot and tired. We have an early flight home in the morning) Arturo,the maintenance man, fixed a "pressure problem" and left. An hour later the air conditioning quit working again.
reviews.title: 1st time and not the last time

reviews.text: We decided it was hopeless at this point and decided to go to bed. My husband thought to check the window to see if we could get any fresh air. The window opened easily!! We had specificly been put in this room on the 11th floor to meet fire code with the crib. My 3 year-old son had spent a good portion of the time in the room sitting of the window sill looking out the window. He would've been able to easily open it. The other window was barely fasted close with a screw.
reviews.title: ALMOST Perfect

likes.liked: — the beautiful room and the view
likes.disliked: — the noise from the nightclub upstairs

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I informed the front desk on the continued AC problems and the danger of the windows as we were quickly leaving for the airport.
reviews.title: Decent
A bit " Faulty Towers".
reviews.text: Stayed for 5 nights in November, 2006. Room was comfortable, king bed, comfy pillows, internet access. Windows were a little dirty and bathroom was "unusual", but I put that down to the fact that it is an old hotel. Keycard on door failed to work for us on several occassions and when reported to front desk, the person on duty was very obliging and offered us free coffee vouchers! The tour desk girl was unprofessional as she took several private phone calls while trying to arrange our tour. My major concern was security as there are several entrances to the hotel anybody can have access to the lifts and we found a "homeless" person trying doors on our floor. I was not comfortable in the lifts on my own. The location is great. The only reason I would not go back is because of lack of security.

Stayed at the Drake for 2 night s in mid January. While the location is excellent be aware of certain issues. First, we got a great rate on a hotel website, only $89 a night, what a deal! BUT parking $90!!!! $45 a night...! I expected the parking to be expensive, maybe $20 a night. $45 is just way too much.. The check in was easy and the front desk staff friendly. Our room... VERY TINY, especially the bathroom.. seriously, there is barely room to turn around... but the room we thought was very nice and classic looking. Another plus, the bar/restaurant on the top floor (oops forgot the name)... its very very romantic and the views are beautiful.
reviews.title: location is excellant BUT..........

likes.liked: — The bar on the top floor has great views of the city

reviews.title: Good location, tiny bathroom
reviews.text: Spent three nights at the Sir Francis Drake on business.
The Good:
reviews.title: Great location - Clean - Classy

reviews.text: - Great location. In the heart of shopping and restaurants of all price ranges. Directly across the street from a Walgreens and in the same block as Tiffany's & Saks. Borders is also across the street.
reviews.title: First Class Hotel

likes.liked: — It had a very luxury feel to it
likes.disliked: — The decor was very traditional which would appeal to some people

reviews.text: This is a great place for the money. Be mindful that much cheaper rates may be available on the hotel's website. Don't count on the reservation staff telling you so. That having been said, when I did find a lower rate online they did honor it.
reviews.title: Great location.
Terrific Hotel
reviews.text: The good: great lounge scene; cool decor; great location; we found the doormen to be more than happy to help, despite contrary reviews on TripAdvisor.

The not so good: rather small rooms; bathrooms are tiny; showers are even smaller; phone was inoperable until the following day when it was fixed; despite request for featherless room, bed had feather pillows and a down duvet.
reviews.title: Nice Location Small Rooms

reviews.text: The bad: $45/day parking; front desk staff couldn't figure out how to email a copy of my bill despite a spot on the check out form to have your bill emailed to you; room windows were absolutely filthy; window in shower did not open; small toilet; single-ply toliet paper (save that for rest areas and airports!).
reviews.title: A Very Disappointing Four Days

reviews.text: We really enjoyed our stay at the Sir Francis Drake. The location is great and the hotel is exactly as represented. The staff was very nice (although when we asked how far Napa was, they said 2 hrs, it's only 1 hr). Parking is a hefty $50 per day, something you need to know before you go.
reviews.title: Do not stay at the Sir Francis Drake

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Let me just start by saying that this was our first trip to San Francisco. My husband and i decided to "ditch" the East Coast when it came to our vacation this summer and go to Sunny California. I had some expectations of this hotel, but not to many given the fact that i had spoken twice to their Concierge, Ken prior to our arrival and both times he was dismissive and rude. I was trying to arrange some activities prior to our arrival and he told me that i didn`t need to book anything in advance ( never mind the fact that i didn`t want to spend my vacation planning my daily activities, hence i was trying to do it in advance) and when I asked about different tour companies that organized day trips outside of San Francisco, he described one of them and let me know that it was for "outdoorsy" people( you think?) and he didnt care much for being in the car for 3 hours on the way to the American River. I actually thought about moving our reservation to another hotel, but it was too late.
reviews.title: A Terrible Disappointment
BEWARE!!! THIS HOTEL HAS THEFT PROBLEMS!!!
reviews.text: The hotel itself is very old, but it does have a lot of charm. The lobby has somewhat of a feeling of grandeur but the years of neglect can easily be noticed. The check-in was pleasant, the Front Desk interaction being amongst the few pleasurable ones we had while we were there.

reviews.title: not worth the cost
reviews.text: The room was very small and very contrasting in what the decor and upgrades were concerned ( the Front Desk upgraded us at check-in because our room was not ready- i didn`t want to see the room we were initially in if THIS was an upgrade). The room had new curtains, new headboard ( with some very suspicious stains on it), a large flat screen TV, 1 night stand, 1 desk and chair. The bathroom seemed remodeled ( new vanity and commode) until you pulled back the shower curtain and you saw the old stained, chipped bathtub. Overall cleanliness- OK Anyway, the room was less important because we spent most of the time sightseeing.

The Concierge Staff at the hotel was still rude and dismissive during our stay so we tried to stay clear of them and on our departure day we called 4 times to arrange for transportation to the airport, left a Voicemail and never heard back from them. Every time we would call the Hotel Operator to let them know that we were trying to get a hold of the concierge and they kept transferring us to the same extension that we had already called and that nobody answered. We finally went downstairs and we were informed by a patronizing Ken( same one as above ) that arranging airport transportation required for us to be physically present at his desk ( which no one had mentioned during our repeated transfer calls) and that he was extremely busy right as he walked in so he had not yet been able to return our call ( although when we arrived at his desk he was not even there and we had to ask the FD to get his from the back area).
reviews.title: I can't believe the reviews are this bad...

likes.liked: — Comfortable beds, whimsical furnishings, view, Aveda products
likes.disliked: — water pressure, room could have been bigger

reviews.text: The conclusion.... I haven`t stayed at any other hotels in San Francisco but I the next time i`m in SF i will gladly try another one. Sir Francis Drake was not bad, and certainly the physical imperfection could have been overlooked if the staff was spectacular. But...
reviews.title: Famous Hotel should actually be Infamous

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I had wanted to go for another hotel which was highly recommended but hubby came across SFDH and would like to try it as the comments were quite ok and the price was also reasonable and union square is just a walking distance!!! and so he booked.
reviews.title: the stay at SFDH

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Nearer to the date of checking in, i saw some not so good feedbacks abt the hotel and i started to worry... but my worries came to an end when we stepped into the hotel room.. I must say it was small but cosy.. the toilet was small but the cleaniness made up for it..
reviews.title: Overly-pretentious, indifferent service.

reviews.text: the location of the hotel is another plus point as there are loads of restaurants everywhere!!! Wal-Green is just opposite the hotel which made it more convenient as it's open 24 by 7.. the cable car stops just right at the doorstep too!!!
reviews.title: Old but great

reviews.text: i would recommend SFDH for the affordable price and great location... I miss SFO...
reviews.title: A new favorite in SF

likes.disliked: — Elevators are a bit slow, food at the Starlight is lacking

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My partner and I chose the Sir Francis Drake because of its reputation as one of the oldest and finest hotels in SF. Unfortunately, while it certainly had quite a history, our stay was forgettable at best, and disillusioning for the most part. To be sure, the location was good. (But there are a ton of other hotels near Union Square.) Rooms were clean, although tiny. Despite our request at the time of booking for a higher floor room, we were put on the 4th floor, where the noise from the cable cars plying Powell Street were in full surround sound. The amenities were also not as the hotel website promised. The complimentary high-speed internet access was not at all stable, and kept falling off. Cable TV was also restricted to CNN and Disney. The corridor smelt funny for a couple of days - like cat food. The staff were also indifferent. Our luggage took 40 minutes to be delivered. Housekeeping continually failed to replenish amenities like shampoo and notepads. Front desk was also incompetent at dealing with customers. At one point, there was a row of customers queueing up to complain about something or other about their room and reservation. We were finally forced to find another hotel to stay for the second of our two-week stay in SF.
reviews.title: great location, good value

reviews.text: Just returned from 4 days with my son's 7/8th grade class at the Sir Francis Drake hotel.
reviews.title: Four Days at the Sir Francis Drake

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It is in a great location for walking to Union Square, the Metreon, Chinatown and the really nice Mall opposite Powell Cablecar/Muni train/Bart Station.
reviews.title: Close to Everything

reviews.text: The staff is helpful and one evening there was even complimentary wine/nuts in the lobby around 6 pm. The view bar on the top floor was filled with really nicely dressed, really young people and there was 80's disco music playing! We went in for one drink, $10 and a $5 cover charge on a Thursday night!
reviews.title: Great Service-Fine Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As with all old hotels the rooms are pretty small as are the bathrooms, but the carpet was new, the bed, nice and the linens were very good. Nice puffy duvets; no plastic blankets. You could not open the windows though.
reviews.title: Loved the Drake!

likes.disliked: — Rooms were a litte small, but really lovely.

reviews.text: The ice machine on my floor did not work, so I had to call the desk every time I wanted ice. The heating/cooling system was a little quirky, but maybe that was because I did not know how to work it! My phone, a cordless, kept losing it's charge so one evening I had to call the desk for my ice on my cell! Someone came right up and fixed it though. Also my mini bar fridge never really got cold.
reviews.title: Unbelievable customer service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at the Drake for a long weekend in November. It is in a great location, just off Union Square and right in front of the Powell Street cablecar stop.
reviews.title: Room to Small

reviews.text: The staff is very friendly and check in was quick.
reviews.title: Very poor

likes.disliked: — Everything. Shabby economy tourist type place

reviews.text: If you like hotels that aren't cookiecutter and don't mind small rooms you may like this hotel. I have stayed at other Kimpton hotels and quite liked them. I did get a very good rate by booking through their Web site.
reviews.title: Not to worry!

likes.liked: — Comfort, and view of the street where we watched the election reactions of the people. Food at Scala.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For this visit I booked a deluxe queen room but was upgraded to a queen room in the tower. The room was quite small with a queen bed and a desk with desk chair. There was no sofa or other chair to sit on and was not room for anything more. The bathroom had a tub that needed to be repainted, a small sink and a toilet. Very little room for toiletries.
reviews.title: Up to Expectations

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had to live out of our suitcase because there was little room for clothing. The wallpaper in the bathroom was gouged in places. The door to the bathroom was difficult to close and stuck when it was finally closed.
reviews.title: It's a little piece of history...

likes.disliked: — The adjoining room - and the thin door in between.

description: The recently renovated Sir Francis Drake Hotel, housed in a landmark building in the heart of Union Square, is quintessential San Francisco: exciting, romantic, timelessly elegant and unique. The ornately decorated lobby, old-world hospitality, and Tom Sweeney, the hotel's infamous Beefeater doorman, transport you to another time and place. The legendary Harry Denton's Starlight Room, the adjacent Scala's Bistro and unmatched hospitality complete the picture to create an unforgettable San Francisco experience.
